trends: There have been 221 other sightings in Chicago
There were no other sightings in Chicago on or around August 12th 2009
divs: Sighting DetailsVigorously flickering "star", shooting out plumes of light periodically, occasional colors (red and maybe yellow), visibly but slowly rising in the sky, maybe 15 degrees in 20 minutes, first noticed at about 45 degrees in the northeast sky. I first noticed it closing the curtains before bed, noticed a star where I don't think I've ever seen one before, then noticed its flicker, colors, and pluming. Especially notable because of the serious light pollution in downtown Chicago; only the very brightest stars are ever visible. Mostly I felt pleasure and wonder. My daughter confirmed its presence and appearance for me. Didn't so much lose sight of it as left it to write this report. It's still there, in fact, 10 mins later, has risen a few more degrees, moving up and easterly.
Summary: Vigorously flickering star, noticeably moving, pluming light, changing colors
